text:
401 to 405 Pearl Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Vandewater Street, showing two 3-story frame houses (Nos. 401 and 403) at and adjoining the corner. Also shown (left) west of the corner are Nos. 41 to 35 Vandewater Street. Today (1937) the frame structures have been replaced by a 2-story garage.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

386 Pearl Street, east side, south of Oak Street. Building is of frame. Note the Second and Third Aves., Elevated Line overhead.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York. Negative No. 11.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH

(1)
pearl Street, east side, north from but not including Madison, to and including Park Row. The Second and Third Aves., Elevated is shown on Park Row, with a Second Ave., Train on the upper level. William Street, is also shown terminating on the west side of Pearl Street, between Park Row and New Chambers Street.
June 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a closer view of Pearl Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Park Row. Pearl Street, at Park Row changes its direction to run east and west when west of Park Row.
September 9, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, as No. 2, showing a closer view of No. 466 Pearl Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of Park Row, which is a frame house.
About 1914.

401-415 Pearl Street, west side, north from and including Vandewater to Rose Streets. The 12-story Scott and Bowne Building (S.W. corner of Rose Street), is Nos. 409-415 Pearl Street.

March 10, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH

original_title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - New Chambers Street
text:
(1)
416-414 Pearl Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of New Chambers Street. Structure shown at the apex, No. 416, is a frame building. Also shown is New Chambers Street eastward. Note the Second Avenue Elevated on New Bowery.

1932

J. Clarence Daview Collection, Museum of the City of New York

(2)
A more inclusive view, showing two sides of this triangular block that has a base on New Bowery ("El" structure thereupon). These structures in View 2 have been rehabilitated by the present owner, Louis Bigolet.

March 11, 1938

P. L. Sperr

(3)
A view showing solely the low corner buildings enumerated in View 1.

October 1, 1938.

George D. Chinn

title: Pearl Street #396 - New Bowery, northwest corner
